While we hope that all who join our guild will enjoy there time with us and remain with us for the duration of their EQ life, we understand that there are times when we all feel like there is something different that we want, and perhaps the grass would be a little greener in another guild.

If you make the choice to disband from the guild, we will wish you well and the blessing of your diety of choice. That said, guild membership should not be taken lightly, and the guild frowns on disbanding to make some petty point or for purposes of "guild hopping." As such, members who leave the guild and later decide they wish to return should expect the following process:

  1. Inform an officer that you wish to rejoin the guild. I brief indication of what changed your mind would be appropriate at this time.
  2. The officer will notify the HC on your behalf that you have requested to rejoin the guild.
  3. The HC will review the reentry request and act upon it - usually within a few Earth days.
  4. Upon HC decision, an officer will contact you to either arrange a reinvite or to indicate *in brief* why your request has been denied and, at the officer's sole descretion, what you might do to change the council's mind at some point in the future. We are sorry, but there is not currently any appeals process at this time. An HC member can, however, ask the full HC to reconsider the matter at a later date.

Another note about disbanding:

In order to keep the guild healthy and happy, we always need feedback. Before disbanding, you are strongly urged to contact an officer and indicate that you are leaving the guild and briefly why you have made this choice. It is considered rude by most guilds (and we are no exception to this particular rule) to just disappear - that is, disband without word, warning, or comment. Again, we wish you well in your future travels, but please allow us to understand your choice so that we may, if appropriate, take that input into the future of the guild.
Rejoining The Exodus Fellowship:
